text: Does anyone have experience with making a major industry change? I've been working in digital marketing/SaaS analytics for 4+ years now. In doing so, I've learned a ton about the ins and outs of digital marketing, and I think that knowledge is an asset anywhere. But I'm struggling to get any traction when applying to content or writing roles in industries I have more personal interest in (entertainment, beauty, social entrepreneurship), I feel like my lack of professional experience in those industries is a deal breaker, even if I have a ton of knowledge on them acquired from sheer personal interest. Any tips on how to approach this are much appreciated!

elements.text: Does anyone have experience with making a major industry change? I've been working in digital marketing/SaaS analytics for 4+ years now. In doing so, I've learned a ton about the ins and outs of digital marketing, and I think that knowledge is an asset anywhere. But I'm struggling to get any traction when applying to content or writing roles in industries I have more personal interest in (entertainment, beauty, social entrepreneurship), I feel like my lack of professional experience in those industries is a deal breaker, even if I have a ton of knowledge on them acquired from sheer personal interest. Any tips on how to approach this are much appreciated!

text: Do you have a personal blog/Instagram that you can point to? That might be helpful as an additional asset to prove that you have a voice when it comes to talking about those industries.

elements.text: Do you have a personal blog/Instagram that you can point to? That might be helpful as an additional asset to prove that you have a voice when it comes to talking about those industries.

text: I am not really a content creator outside of work. Which is largely because I do it for money, and spending even more time behind screens outside of work reaaaaally burns me out. But I may need to suck it up and deal in the name of a portfolio.

elements.text: I am not really a content creator outside of work. Which is largely because I do it for money, and spending even more time behind screens outside of work reaaaaally burns me out. But I may need to suck it up and deal in the name of a portfolio.

text: Yea, my biggest piece of advice is to build a personal brand on the platform that would best allow you to showcase what you want to do. Feel free to DM if you want to share more details and get more tactical advice to your specific situation.

elements.text: Yea, my biggest piece of advice is to build a personal brand on the platform that would best allow you to showcase what you want to do. Feel free to DM if you want to share more details and get more tactical advice to your specific situation.

text: Yeah, I get it. It's tiring, and it sucks to do it when you're ALSO doing it for work :confused: but I think it's probably the easiest way to get an entry into those industries if you're finding it difficult now â€” if you have a lot of knowledge on it but no one KNOWS that you have it, it's hard to prove anything.

elements.text: Yeah, I get it. It's tiring, and it sucks to do it when you're ALSO doing it for work

but I think it's probably the easiest way to get an entry into those industries if you're finding it difficult now â€” if you have a lot of knowledge on it but no one KNOWS that you have it, it's hard to prove anything.

text: Besides, hopefully if it's a topic you like it won't be as exhausting to work on once you get started?

elements.text: Besides, hopefully if it's a topic you like it won't be as exhausting to work on once you get started?

text:
One of the easiest ways to break into an industry of your choice is to create content on the same.

If beauty and entertainment is your choice, then start getting active on Instagram and create a simple blog. You can use Medium for that as well. 

Once you have a decent number of posts (on your Insta handle and blog), that becomes your portfolio. 

Go on LinkedIn and start reaching out to mags catering to this niche. They usually hire paid contributors. That's your way in!

If beauty and entertainment is your choice, then start getting active on Instagram and create a simple blog. You can use Medium for that as well. 

Once you have a decent number of posts (on your Insta handle and blog), that becomes your portfolio. 

Go on LinkedIn and start reaching out to mags catering to this niche. They usually hire paid contributors. That's your way in!
